tickets.subject: FW: Ad for 419 Colony Crest Dr is ready [1 alert]
tickets.raw_subject: FW: Ad for 419 Colony Crest Dr is ready [1 alert]
tickets.description:
Hi gang,

 

I’ve tried calling to no avail . . . so I will now forward you the information.

 

I received this email this AM.

 

I have never used Adwerx.

 

First off, the bathroom count in wrong.

Second, the photo looks horrible . . . the top of the home is chopped off.

 

Every time I go to log in it says my password is incorrect.  Francesca, our admin, said that it should automatically log me in through our system . . . my concern is that I change my password and it screws up everything on my computer . . . Which is why I called to start with.

 

 

I do not want my client seeing this because it is wrong and looks horrible.  I need to get this resolved before it goes out . . . and I have to leave the office shortly . . .

 

Can someone please help me?

 

Thanks a million,

 

Barb

 

Barb Conkin-Orrock

Presidents Club
Alain Pinel Realtors
167 S. San Antonio Rd. #1
Los Altos, CA 94022
650-209-1539 Office

650-996-4106 Cell

tickets.subject: Glitch in CRM stand alone
tickets.description:
Hi Sean,
I just wanted to run let you know about something I stumbled across today when I was doing the eBlast open house announcements for one of our agents…
The agent emailed me…but actually emailed me the wrong MLS#. As you know when you do the OH eblast, you enter  the number under the “Select A Property by Listing#” and it then auto populates the information into the flyer etc…
Well today I just so happened to notice once I looked up the property ( as I always do to look at the pics to get an idea on how to describe it) it wasn’t even our listing. It was a listing by Sereno Group. What is scary is that I wanted to see if just by some chance I would have used that wrong MLS number (Sereno listing) what would have happened. It actually let me use it!!!! And it generated an APR OH eblast all set to go out to the 3,652 Real Estate agents in the Santa Clara county! I just wanted to bring this to marketing’s attention because if any agent decides to do this on their own it’s something that could be a big mistake!
I am sure the Sereno agent would have received it and DEFINITLY gotten a little upset!
I was under the impression that the SAVI CRM campaigns would only pull APR listings??

Darci Marandon
ASSISTANT TO DAVE WALSH
Alain Pinel Realtors®, Almaden
O 408.754.1500 | C 408.348.1217
*I have not and will not verify or investigate the information supplied by third parties.

tickets.subject: FW: Phishing Email Supposedly from C.A.R.
tickets.raw_subject: FW: Phishing Email Supposedly from C.A.R.
tickets.description:
Hi

 

My daughter belongs to the Board of Realtors in Mammoth Lakes , CA. She just sent me this . You may look into it and make all our Agents aware of this.

Thank you.

 

Carla

 

Carla Priola Anisman,R.Estate Broker

Woodside,Ca94062

DRE#00916725

Cell: 650-888-9521

 

From: Sarah Anisman [mailto:sar_ani@me.com]
Sent: Thursday, May 17, 2018 1:11 PM
To: Carla Anisman <canisman@apr.com>
Subject: Fwd: Phishing Email Supposedly from C.A.R.

 

 

Sarah Anisman, M.S.

Sent from my iPhone


Begin forwarded message:

From: Mammoth Lakes Board of Realtors <info@mlbor.com>
Date: May 17, 2018 at 12:57:25 PM PDT
To: Mammoth Lakes Board of Realtors <info@mlbor.com>
Subject: Phishing Email Supposedly from C.A.R.

Hello REALTORS(r),
Just in case you did not see this from the California Association of REALTORS(r)...
Phishing Email Supposedly from C.A.R.
C.A.R. was recently alerted to an email purporting to be from C.A.R. The subject line reads "INFORMATION TO ALL ACTIVE MEMBERS" and is from the email address mail@car.org. The email requests recipients to follow a link and sign in with their email to view information from C.A.R. to all active members. It also reads, "This announcement has been uploaded for your kind information through our secure information sharing portal which is linked to your email server. Contact us for more details. Regards, CALIFORNIA ASSOCIATION OF REALTORS."

This email is not from C.A.R. and recipients of this email address should not open it or click on any links. If you've received this email, please delete it from your inbox immediately. It is a phishing email and your information is at risk.

As a reminder, phishing scams are on the rise. To avoid being scammed by phishing schemes, the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) offers these tips:
Never e-mail your financial information. Email is not considered secure.
Check the security of the website. For any financial information you provide over the web, check that the site is secure. The URL should being with https.
Be careful what you click on. Don't click a link in an email to an organization's site. Instead, look up the real URL, and type it in yourself.
Be cautious about opening attachments and downloading any files from e-mails.
Make sure your operating system, browser, and security system are up-to-date.

Click here for more info about phishing schemes<http://subscribe.car.org/e/85202/articles-0003-phishing/5fktgw/426716386>

Sincerely,
Stacey Castellano
Association Executive
Mammoth Lakes Board Of REALTORS(r)
PO Box 1007
Mammoth Lakes, CA 93546
760-934-4637
